blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: My smut theory is that because sex is a part of a lot of relationships, If someone writes the cute fluffy parts of dan and...
question: My smut theory is that because sex is a part of a lot of relationships, If someone writes the cute fluffy parts of dan and Phil’s relationship, they’ll write about the sexual parts, too. And I’ll admit that it is kind of weird even if I do occasionally read it.
answer: That’s what I mean when I say I’m not totally against it if it’s part of a bigger story. It’s still weird, but at least in my head I can justify it as “yes of course we’ve been reading about their slow-burn romance for 25 chapters now this was bound to happen” but even then, I would almost prefer if the sex scenes were vaguely described or hinted at, instead of being written in detail.

reblog.comment: That’s what I mean when I say I’m not totally against it if it’s part of a bigger story. It’s still weird, but at least in my head I can justify it as “yes of course we’ve been reading about their slow-burn romance for 25 chapters now this was bound to happen” but even then, I would almost prefer if the sex scenes were vaguely described or hinted at, instead of being written in detail.

trail.content_raw: That’s what I mean when I say I’m not totally against it if it’s part of a bigger story. It’s still weird, but at least in my head I can justify it as “yes of course we’ve been reading about their slow-burn romance for 25 chapters now this was bound to happen” but even then, I would almost prefer if the sex scenes were vaguely described or hinted at, instead of being written in detail.
trail.content: That’s what I mean when I say I’m not totally against it if it’s part of a bigger story. It’s still weird, but at least in my head I can justify it as “yes of course we’ve been reading about their slow-burn romance for 25 chapters now this was bound to happen” but even then, I would almost prefer if the sex scenes were vaguely described or hinted at, instead of being written in detail.

blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: 1) i obviously can't know such things for sure, but i've always thought both of them are quite awkward people, and from what...
question: 1) i obviously can't know such things for sure, but i've always thought both of them are quite awkward people, and from what i've seen phil seems to be more self-conscious, private and more modest out of them both (if it's even the right word?). or at least he'd become like that after he matured as a person. i don't think he's comfortable with being the center of everyone's attention and he also said he gets uncomfortable on behalf of other people a lot.
answer:
“2) and judging by that story dan told about how phil was uncomfortable when those drunk women were cat calling him, i honestly can’t understand how he would be totally ok with so many random internet strangers talking about his genitals or about his sex life, + those nsfw drawings. i don’t see him as the type of person who would actually enjoy that or be flattered by that. like, not when it’s being done by so many people for so many years and not after the whole leaked video incident”


…


Honestly, it’s hard to say with things like this. It’s hard to say “don’t do that it’s wrong” when we don’t actually know how Dan and Phil feel about it. We’re not in their heads, we don’t know what their opinion is.


But, putting myself in their shoes, I know for a fact I would hate it. A tasteful nude for artistic purposes, fine. You’re gonna write me into a sex scene that has relevance to a bigger story? Whatever. But I cannot imagine a universe in which I’d be okay with people drawing or writing explicit material about me just for the sake of getting off to it, or getting others off to it.


And what weirds me out even more, is the fact that so many of Dan and Phil’s fanbase are underage. Like, I understand that teenagers aren’t these pure innocent little things and they have sexual desires and shit and there’s nothing wrong with that. But imagine being a 30 year old man and knowing that there are thousands of 16 year old girls drawing porn of you. Like, legally, morally, I don’t think you’re allowed to be okay with that.

…

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Maybe it's hard for you to wrap your finger around the smut thing because you're ace? Because I'll admit that I do read it, and...
question: Maybe it's hard for you to wrap your finger around the smut thing because you're ace? Because I'll admit that I do read it, and it does turn me on. But the thing is it isn't the characters that turn me on, it's the sex act in itself. I could honestly be reading about two random stick figures boning and it would probably do just as much for me. It just so happens that the writing community in the phandom is massive, which makes it accessible, and a lot of it is made by insanely talented people.
answer: I’m sure that has something to do with it, but I think the bigger part is the fact that these are real, actual people. And it’s not like Dan and Phil are porn stars, whose entire job is to be sexy for you. They’re just dudes. And it seems weird to me that people are thinking so intently about these two dudes having sex, that they feel the need to create something to visualize it even better. Like, if it’s just that you like writing about sex, or drawing sex, that’s fine. But the fact that the artist has included two actual people instead of making up characters, leads me to believe that they’ve included them for a reason. And that reason is probably, even if only subconsciously, a little fetishistic.

reblog.comment: I’m sure that has something to do with it, but I think the bigger part is the fact that these are real, actual people. And it’s not like Dan and Phil are porn stars, whose entire job is to be sexy for you. They’re just dudes. And it seems weird to me that people are thinking so intently about these two dudes having sex, that they feel the need to create something to visualize it even better. Like, if it’s just that you like writing about sex, or drawing sex, that’s fine. But the fact that the artist has included two actual people instead of making up characters, leads me to believe that they’ve included them for a reason. And that reason is probably, even if only subconsciously, a little fetishistic.

trail.content_raw: I’m sure that has something to do with it, but I think the bigger part is the fact that these are real, actual people. And it’s not like Dan and Phil are porn stars, whose entire job is to be sexy for you. They’re just dudes. And it seems weird to me that people are thinking so intently about these two dudes having sex, that they feel the need to create something to visualize it even better. Like, if it’s just that you like writing about sex, or drawing sex, that’s fine. But the fact that the artist has included two actual people instead of making up characters, leads me to believe that they’ve included them for a reason. And that reason is probably, even if only subconsciously, a little fetishistic.
trail.content: I’m sure that has something to do with it, but I think the bigger part is the fact that these are real, actual people. And it’s not like Dan and Phil are porn stars, whose entire job is to be sexy for you. They’re just dudes. And it seems weird to me that people are thinking so intently about these two dudes having sex, that they feel the need to create something to visualize it even better. Like, if it’s just that you like writing about sex, or drawing sex, that’s fine. But the fact that the artist has included two actual people instead of making up characters, leads me to believe that they’ve included them for a reason. And that reason is probably, even if only subconsciously, a little fetishistic.
